intro: Mollia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly mollia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features hairy, grayish-green leaves and produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Mollia tomentosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in garden settings.
